title: Untapped potential of scrap brass alloy: a new frontier in the use of brass-based photocathodes for stable and durable photoelectrochemical water splitting
content:
Energy Adv., 2024, 3,430-441
DOI: 10.1039/D3YA00534H, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Rahma Leil, Mohamed Mahrous Abodouh, Nasir Javed, Sneha Sreekumar, Haydee Pacheco, Nada Tarek, Deirdre M. O’Carroll, Nageh K. Allam
Photoelectrochemical (PEC) water splitting is a promising way to produce green hydrogen. Finding a stable photocathode is important to the development of (PEC) water splitting. This work aims to use scrap brass alloy as a stable photocathode.
